subject: RE: [junit] IllegalArgumentException
msgSnippet: Pedro, You might also be interested in the expected attribute of the Test annotation as documented here: http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_7
messageBody:
Pedro,



You might also be interested in the expected attribute of the Test annotation as documented here:



http://junit.sourceforge.net/doc/faq/faq.htm#tests_7



Hope that helps,



Rocco



From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Joakim Ohlrogge
Sent: Saturday, January 31, 2009 7:40 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] IllegalArgumentException



Just to be sure: Did you copy paste the code or retype it? The Class1 should
not compile since it says throws new IllegalArgumentException("fail");
rather than throw new IllegalArgumentException("fail");
Since you did not post the whole code it's hard to know wether you are using
jUnit4 or JUnit3. If you are using JUnit4 then the testmethod must be
annotated with @Test, if you are using JUnit3 your testclass mus extend
TestCase and all tests must be prefixed with test (like your testMethod1)

/J

On Fri, Jan 30, 2009 at 7:24 PM, pedrogabrielvecchi
<pedro.vecchi@... <mailto:pedro.vecchi%40gmail.com> >wrote:

> Hello:
>
> I´m new in Junit.
> When I run the program never execute the sentence
> assertEquals("fail", e.getMessage());, never arrives here.
> thanks in advance
>
> I use the following code in Class1.java:
>
> public void method1() throws IllegalArgumentException {
>
> List<Long> list01 = new ArrayList<Long>();
> list01 = null;
>
> if (list01 == null) {
> throws new IllegalArgumentException("fail");
> }
>
> }
>
> in TestClass1.java
>
> public void testMethod01() {
>
> try {
> Class1 class1 = new Class1();
> class1.method1();
> } catch (IllegalArgumentException e) {
> assertEquals("fail", e.getMessage());
> }
>
> }
>
>
>
